title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer hints at regret over Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez transfers
text:
Alexis Sanchez and Romelu Lukaku both joined Inter from Manchester United this summer (Picture: Getty)

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer admits several of Manchester United’s youngsters have been promoted to the first team ahead of schedule in light of the departures of Alexis Sanchez and Romelu Lukaku.

The Norwegian made it a priority during the summer to rid his squad of players who were either ill-suited to his tactical plans, or did not want to be at Old Trafford any longer.

Despite an abundance of Premier League experience and goals, Sanchez and Lukaku were both permitted to join Inter Milan in August, leaving Solskjaer short of attacking options.

United routed Chelsea on the opening weekend of the new season, but have since found goals hard to come by, particularly following the injury which has ruled Anthony Martial out for the last two months.

The likes of Angel Gomes and Tahith Chong have featured regularly this term but, unlike fellow teenager Mason Greenwood, they have struggled to make an impact.

Although Solskjaer maintains it was the right decision to sanction the departures of Sanchez and Lukaku, he admits he may have placed unrealistic expectations upon several of the club’s most promising academy graduates.

Angel Gomes, Tahith Chong, Mason Greenwood and James Garner have all been promoted to Man Utd’s first team squad this season (Picture: Getty)

He told Sky Sports: ‘In one-off games, you think we could’ve had a number of extra players with experience. Alexis and Rom are goalscorers and good players, but at the moment, we made those decisions and they were the right decisions.

‘That’s the only way you’ve got to look at it. All the players here want to give everything for the club and for the shirt – that’s a big thing.

‘Every day that they come in training, and every day that they put the shirt on, they’re going to give everything that they have. So you can’t really say, ‘oh I wish I didn’t do that’.

‘Giving a couple of the lads the chance to show themselves, maybe it was a little bit too early for a few of them. But Mason Greenwood has stepped in and scored a couple in the midweek games, so it’s a great experience for them.

‘We know we haven’t had the results that we wanted, but I wouldn’t have kept the players we sold. It was the right decision.’
